author: gustapug
title: Miscellaneous
description: How do we create a space for brilliant ideas and projects that do not fit any of the other current challenges?

f6_assessments.q0: On the one hand, this challenge allows the community to have an open space for those ideas and proposals that do not fit into an existing challenge. On the other hand, it can be considered, from my perspective, as a kind of "problem sensing" challenge since, while there is a wide variety of challenges that are critical for Cardano to succeed, I also recognize that we may have blind spots in this area. Additionally, this same characteristic leaves the door open for all proposals with passion to deliver value and fulfill one of the strategic goals of fund 9. However, I believe the challenge team could have made a better effort in defining the challenge configuration, for example, considerations for future proposers to have open-source features from the conception of the project or at least consider open-source features minimally in the strategic plan of the proposal. My score for this section is 4.
f6_assessments.q1: It is worth noting that in Fund 7, there were 68 proposals competing, of which 32 were approved by the community and finally 17 were chosen as winners, while in Fund 8, there are 89 proposals seeking funding, which represents an increase of approximately 30% and is the third challenge with the highest number of proposals. The data presented here indicates a clear capacity, and above all the need, for the community to continue to take on this challenge. Considering that there was a 30% increase in the number of proposals and in Fund 7 there were 15 proposals that were approved by the community but were not allocated funds, I would have recommended increasing the budget for Fund 9 to a minimum of $800,000.
f6_assessments.q2: Due to the characteristics of this challenge, it can be understood that the definition of success metrics cannot be simple due to the anticipated variability of proposals, however, considering that this challenge has already been conducted in the past, I would have preferred to see an update in the challenge settings based on what has been learned. Regarding the metrics presented, they are focused on measuring the overall performance of this challenge, which seems appropriate to me. My score for this section is 4.
f6_assessments.reply: Flagged for personal opinion or bias: in ALIGNMENT, the CA is assessing the challenge setting on the basis of what s/he would have done, rather than assessing it on its own merits. S/he suggests that the challenge setting should have required proposals to be open source - while this might make a good challenge, it would be a different challenge from this one. It's not valid to assess a challenge setting on the basis that it does not match your own idea for a challenge setting. In VERIFIABILITY, the CA does the same thing, saying "I would have preferred to see an update in the challenge settings based on what has been learned".  This is personal opinion based on pure guesswork on their part as to what *has* been learned - in fact, what was learned from fund 7 was that the challenge metrics were appropriate and effective, which is why we did not significantly "update" them. So the CA's rating is based on a mistaken rationale.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge creates space for new ideas and projects that can't find place in any current challenge. To be able to fund good ideas, and not miss out on opportunities of including creatives to Cardano ecosystem that are not covered elsewhere. 
The challenge is important to Cardano Catalyst community, and it has proven to be part of ecosystem since Fund7, with 141 proposals submitted in the current Fund8 round.
f6_assessments.q1:
Very well written challenge. This challenge is feasible as it proved to be in Fund7, and in current fund, the demand is high. In challenge brief it is written as to which proposals should apply and in concise wording explained what are the constraints. Furthermore, the challenge alignment describes the process in which the team and the community will help the proposers find their right place in Catalyst space. 
The challenge team is comprised of 5 members, bringing the experience from previous funding rounds, I can strongly agree that this challenge will continue to successfully onboard new ideas to Cardano community.
f6_assessments.q2:
At the end of the funding round the team is asking if the challenge was valuable to the community, this will be assessed through two simple points.
The 2nd one is especially significant one, as it asks, if there is enough traction around a project that can be motivation for new forms of challenges in future funding rounds.
The budget is set to USD 500k, same as in the current round. 
I suggest for future funding rounds to delegate funding for this challenge accordingly, over 100 projects in this challenge, it should reflect on adding more funds to support this growing interest.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal offers numerous advantages for Catalyst and Cardano. By providing a miscellaneous challenge you're making sure that proposers are not bound to a specific subject. This has a positive effect and the proposals being posted because if you don't have challenge settings where anything is welcome you either force a proposer to adjust his proposal to fit within a challenge setting or you make them not submit it. This challenge addresses the strategic goals perfectly. It provides more contribution, thinking outside the box which in turn boost the growth and evolution of Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding Feasibility, this challenge gives plenty of room for the community to address this challenge. Since its a miscellaneous challenge it has no special requirements for a challenge to fall within. As a Community advisor, you are left completely free to determine if a proposal benefits the ecosystem or if the proposal was a better fit within another challenge. The budget requested for this challenge is more than reasonable. A surplus is that the team remains the same in F8 and F9.
f6_assessments.q2: When we look at this proposal in the previous funds it's more than obvious that this is a proposal needed. The success and metrics of the proposal are coherent and adequate. Great asset by referring to the previous fund and collecting data from it.

f6_assessments.q0: This by far is one of the best Challenge that came from nowhere. It has proven from it's first iteration to pinpoint a need of a certain Challenge, through data. Although I am not in the loop of things, I am quite sure we can gauge the community's interest of a specific topic if it came out in numbers in the Miscl. Challenge. With that said, this proposal is absolute critical for it functions as a sensory array system also. But at the same, it also provides funding for the ideas that we might have overlooked and not think of. This proposal to an extent, accentuates the most beloved story in history, the story of how one individual can make a huge impact. A great Challenge idea from the proposer, whoever that individual is.
f6_assessments.q1: Since this proposal very much can encompass anything and everything, it becomes a yes or no answer. For perhaps there is a specific proposal where no one from the community can address correctly and specifically. We have to an extent seen this in the more technical challenges which identifies the growing need of a specialized Community Advisor. And we could also say yes, we the community can address this Challenge for we have build the various structures and knowledge pools to do so.
f6_assessments.q2: Since the possibilities of types of proposals that enter this Challenge can be limitless. Keeping success criteria and metrics as is or as simple as possible, is fitting. It does not push towards this Challenge being a certain box. It allows for the creative mind to go wild. I am actually betting this Challenge will teach us all to understand, the mission of Project Catalyst as a innovation platform. We are basically letting the most audacious plan possible to come by and blow our minds away. With that said, reckon we gamble a bit and push up the funds provided into $1 million in ADA.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge is for creating a space for ideas and projects that do not fit any of the other challenges. This challenge has already existed in previous Funds, but it is still and always needed in the next Funds, because there will always have brilliant projects and ideas that is not fit in with any challenge, but still impactful and crucial. So if we don't have this challenge, these projects and ideas will be missing out.
f6_assessments.q1: The Miscellaneous challenge on the past Funds are successful: there are 109 Fund 8 proposals submitted. Therefore it's likely that The Catalyst community continues having the capacity to address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: The Success criteria and suggested metrics are the same as current ones on The Miscellaneous challenge of Fund 8. They are already set correctly to measure progress in addressing the challenge.

importance: It enables great ideas to be funded even if they don't fit any other challenge, and makes space for new and inventive thinking.
success: Funding great new ideas that are not covered elsewhere. Seeing these ideas find their place in Catalyst via future challenge settings.
